summary: The 'End Prescription Drug Ads Now Act' aims to ban drug manufacturers from directly advertising prescription drugs to consumers. The bill amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act by prohibiting any promotional communication targeting consumers through various media, including social media. This applies to drugs approved under section 505 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act or licensed under section 351 of the Public Health Service Act. The ban would take effect 30 days after the bill's enactment.
